1.text: In that day this song shall be sung in the land of Judah: A strong city to us; he will set salvation the wall and the fortification.

2.text: Open ye the gates and the just nation watching truths shall come in.

3.text: The mind placed upon thee thou wilt form peace, peace, because he trusted in thee.

4.text: Trust ye in Jehovah even to eternity, for in Jah Jehovah is the rock of ages.

5.text: For he bows down those dwelling in height; for the city set up on high he will bring it down; he will bring it down even to the earth; he will cause it to touch even to the dust.

6.text: The foot shall tread it down, the feet of the humble, the steps of the poor.

7.text: The way to the just one is straightness: being upright, thou wilt prepare the departing of the just one.

8.text: Also the way of thy judgments, O Jehovah, we hoped for thee; to thy name and to thy remembrance is the desire of the soul.

9.text: My soul desired thee in the night; also my spirit in the midst of me I will seek thee: for when thy judgments to the earth, those dwelling in the habitable globe will learn justice.

10.text: Shall the unjust be shown favor? He learnt not justice; in the land of justice he will act perversely, and he will not see the majesty of Jehovah.

11.text: O Jehovah, high thy hand, they will not see: they shall see and be ashamed for their jealousy of the people; also the fire of thine enemies shall consume them.

12.text: O Jehovah, thou wilt judge peace for us: for also all our works thou didst for us.

13.text: O Jehovah our God, lords besides thee had dominion over us; but in thee alone will we make mention of thy name.

14.text: The dead shall not live; shades shall not rise; for this, thou reviewedst and thou wilt destroy them, and all remembrance to them shall perish.

15.text: Thou didst add to the nation, O Jehovah, thou didst add to the nation thou wert honored: thou didst put far; away all the ends of the earth.

16.text: O Jehovah, in straits they looked after thee; they poured out a whispering thy correction to them.

17.text: As she conceiving will draw near to bring forth, she will be pained and cry out in her pangs, thus were we from before thee, O Jehovah.

18.text: We conceived, we were pained, thus we brought forth wind; we shall not make the earth salvation, the inhabitants of the habitable globe shall not fall.

19.text: Thy dead shall live, with my corpse shall they rise. Awake and shout, ye dwelling in dust: for the dew of brightness is thy dew, and the land of the shades shall fall.

20.text: Go, my people, enter into thy apartments and shut thy doors about thee: hide thee as a little moment till the wrath shall pass by.

21.text: For behold, Jehovah will come forth out of his place to review the iniquity of him dwelling in the earth upon him; and the earth uncovered her bloods, and she will no more cover over her slain.
